trustfund:
TF026695-PHRD-UKRAINE: PREPARATION OF
            THE SECOND PROGRAMMATIC ADJUSTMENT LOAN,TF050270-PROGRAMMATIC ADJUSTMENT LOAN
            (PAL) PROGRAMME IN UKRAINE,TFM50270-PROGRAMMATIC ADJUSTMENT LOAN
            (PAL) PROGRAMME IN UKRAINE,TFS50270-PROGRAMMATIC ADJUSTMENT LOAN
            (PAL) PROGRAMME IN UKRAINE

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Second Programmatic
            Adjustment Loan for Ukraine was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was highly likely, the institutional
            development impact was substantial, the Bank performance was
            highly satisfactory, and the borrower performance was
            satisfactory. Lessons learned from the project: A
            multi-sectoral design and cross-agency implementation
            strategy proved useful to address inter-locking binding
            constraints. A high level, multi-sectoral government working
            group is an effective mechanism for monitoring
            implementation and resolving issues. This mechanism also
            provided an appropriate avenue for effective coordination
            with other development partners. Development policy lending
            works well when based on the government's own
            priorities and when the government owns the process. Even
            when program extends over a period of years, it is important
            to be realistic on what can be accomplished during this period.
